frame.name: Being_detached
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Item</fen> is detached from a <fen>Source</fen>, or <fen>Items</fen> are detached from each other.
<ex>When <fex name="itm">the snow plow</fex> is <t>disconnected</t> <fex name="src">from the vehicle</fex>, extend the lift cylinder to the end of its stroke and coat the chrome rod with a light grease.</ex>
<ex><fex name="itm">The gold leaves that</fex> are <t>unattached</t> <fex name="src">to the engraved surfaces</fex> fall off.</ex> <ex>By 5:00 to 5:30 (depending on the time of year) <fex name="itm">the boat</fex> is <t>unmoored</t> and loaded.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that is detached from a <fen>Source</fen>.
<ex>I feel like <fex name="itm">my head</fex> is <t>detached</t> from the rest of my body.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Items
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are detached from each other.
<ex><fex name="Items">The neck vertebrae</fex> are <t>unfused</t> in rorquals and gray whales, which allows for some flexibility at the head and neck.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Source</fen> identifies the location from which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is detached.
<ex>The toilet is <t>loose</t> <fex name="src">from the floor</fex> and must be repaired.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Item</fen> is in an detached state relative to a <fen>Source</fen>, or two <fen>Items</fen> are detached from each other.
</def-root>
